Uses of Package
se.jbee.inject.bind

Packages that use se.jbee.inject.bind
se.jbee.inject.bind   
se.jbee.inject.service   
 

Classes in se.jbee.inject.bind used by se.jbee.inject.bind
BasicBinder
          The minimal BasicBinder.TypedBasicBinder to bind should illustrate the stages.
BasicBinder.RootBasicBinder
          The ROOT- BasicBinder.RootBasicBinder.
BasicBinder.ScopedBasicBinder
          A Scope had been defined.
BasicBinder.TargetedBasicBinder
          Bindings have been restricted and are just effective within a special scope defined before using BasicBinder.ScopedBasicBinder.injectingInto(Instance)-clauses.
BasicBinder.TypedBasicBinder
          The Type of the Resource defined is already given using BasicBinder.bind(Instance)
Binder
          The default implementation of the BasicBinder that provides a lot of utility methods to improve readability and keep binding compact.
Binder.RootBinder
           
Binder.ScopedBinder
           
Binder.TargetedBinder
           
Binder.TypedBinder
           
Binder.TypedElementBinder
          This kind of bindings actually re-map the []-type so that the automatic behavior of returning all known instances of the element type will no longer be used whenever the bind made applies.
Bindings
          The binding-builders are just utilities to construct calls to Bindings.add(Resource, Supplier, Scope, Source)
Bootstrapper
          The basic idea is to split the binding process into 2 steps: installing modules and do bindings in the installed modules.
Bootstrapper.ModularBootstrapper
           
BootstrappingModule
           
BuildinBundle
          Installs all the build-in functionality by using the core API.
Bundle
          A bundle installs sub-bundles and Modules.
Bundler
          Determines all reachable Bundles starting from a root Bundle.
Const
           
Constants
          Constants are used to model configurations of the Bootstrapping process through one enum for each configurable property.
ConstructionStrategy
          A ConstructionStrategy picks the Constructor to use to construct objects of a given Class.
Edition
          An Edition decides wich features are contained in a specific setup.
Extension
           
Feature
          Features can be used to model more fine grained Edition by using enums as the options to chose from.
Linker
           
ModularBundle
          A Bundle that does different installation for different options.
Modulariser
          Determines / extracts the Module result from a root Bundle.
Module
          Bindings are defined with Modules while Bundle are used to group multiple Modules and Bundles what allows to build graphs of Bundles with Modules as leafs.
 

Classes in se.jbee.inject.bind used by se.jbee.inject.service

          The minimal BasicBinder.TypedBasicBinder to bind should illustrate the stages.

          The ROOT- BasicBinder.RootBasicBinder.

          Bindings have been restricted and are just effective within a special scope defined before using BasicBinder.ScopedBasicBinder.injectingInto(Instance)-clauses.
Binder.TypedBinder
           
BinderModule
          The default utility Module almost always used.
Bindings
          The binding-builders are just utilities to construct calls to Bindings.add(Resource, Supplier, Scope, Source)
Bootstrapper
          The basic idea is to split the binding process into 2 steps: installing modules and do bindings in the installed modules.
BootstrappingModule
           
Bundle
          A bundle installs sub-bundles and Modules.
ConstructionStrategy
          A ConstructionStrategy picks the Constructor to use to construct objects of a given Class.
Extension
           
Module
          Bindings are defined with Modules while Bundle are used to group multiple Modules and Bundles what allows to build graphs of Bundles with Modules as leafs.
